text:
A group of 35 Hindu pilgrims from southern Sindh have been detained in Rajasthan over ‘incomplete travel documents’. The group left for a 20-day pilgrimage to India on March 18 through the Thar Express via the Munabao rail link, the Express Tribune quoted Laxman, the family member of one of the arrested individuals as saying.

Media reports said the Rajasthan police arrested them for allegedly violating their visa rules. The pilgrims had visas for Mathura and Haridwar cities but they instead visited Ramdevra. — ANI
title: 35 pilgrims from Pakistan detained in Rajasthan
